page.title: 09New Silksworth (cont)
page.content: Soon after 1967 the{colliery}closed and{New Silksworth}lost one of it's larger employers. The spoil heap which the colliery created has now being converted into a ski slope and recreation centre. The important streets in{New {Silksworth}are{Blind lane}and {Silksworth Terrace}where shops and amenites are located. { Blind Lane}takes its name from the time when horses used to pull carts up and down the lane. The horses were reluctant to pull the heavy loads up the incline and were blindfolded so that they didnt know in which direction they were travelling. In the days when the coal mine was in use{New Silksworth}was a closely knit mining community but now there are no industries which employ the large numbers of people.
